choices: It is Just Lilith(at this point)
1.content:
8/29/09 8:52 Am Eastern Time

The light stabbed at Sara's eyes as the 22 year old laid in bed. Dan rolled over and slid his hand across her belly rubbing it gently before kissing her neck. A small mummer left Sara's lips before Dan moved his down over Sara's belly button.
"Sara I need to..." Lilith Sara's room mate swung open the door and then quickly slammed it.
"Oh, sorry I did not mean to.." Lilith said behind the door.
"Do you want to join me in the shower, hun?" Dan asked as he stroked Sara's cheek
"No, you go ahead I think I know what Lilith wanted to talk about." Sara said as she slipped out from under the sheet. Sara walked over to the closet, staring at Dan's Sexy 24 year old butt, before wrapping a towel around her naked form. Sara walked out into the living room where Lilith would most likely be. Lilith was sprawled out on the floor in a state of shock shaking violently as a stroke ran through her body.
"Dan call a ambulance!" Sara yelled as she held Lilith's head. Lilith convulsed and shook as Sara's cheeks were stained with tears.
"It is not working!" Dan yelled as he ran into the living room holding the phone.

At this time your call can not be completed please try back at a later time

"It is not working." Dan tried the police department then the fire department and found the phone still useless. Dan dropped the phone and then grabbed Lilith's legs as they kicked wildly.
"Grab her arms." Dan said looking at Sara as she wiped the tears from her eyes. She grabbed Lilith's arms before being pulled by Dan as he made his way out to the pickup.
"Stay with her back here." Dan said and then got into the truck and started the engine. Lilith let out a sudden blood curdling scream and then went limp.
1.title: They begin

12.content:
"Mommy? Tammy said concerned in the back seat as her mother fell over the steering wheel an began convulsing. Tammy un buckled her seat belt and then moved over the seat shaking her mothers shoulder. The 5 year old let out a scream seeing the foam coming from her mothers mouth. That scream was silenced as the car slammed into a barrier. The driver behind Tammie's mother swerved and slammed into a tractor trailer. The Semi driver already in a state of convulsion slid and then crushed the car in front of him.
The sound of cars striking each other entered Dan's ears before thee train three blocks away could be heard screeching against the steel tracks. What followed was the breaking of wood and twisting of steel as the passenger train cars slid off the tracks. The sound of the crushing of homes was quickly pulled from Dan's mind as he looked in shock at all the people as they scrambled. It was weird despite the massive loss Dan noticed that he found comfort in Sara over everything else. The single thought of her still being with him made the destruction less shocking.
A few hours had passed and it seemed that whatever had caused the event was over. Dan held Sara in his arms as they lay in the couch, Despite there efforts to get Lilith to the hospital she had died even before the train hit.
"I just can't believe she is gone. I mean and the weird thing is that no one.." Sara's words drifted off as she seen a special bulletin flash across the screen.


.....at this point it seems that the epidemic of world wide proportions has swept the globe. Scientist have yet to confirm any solid cause for the events that have swept the globe over the few minutes leaving untold amounts suddenly dead or injured. The only thing officials and scientist are saying at this point is that the only similarity of the people affected is the date of birth in the month of October...

When were Dan and Sara born?
12.title: Tammy

122.content:
....It seems that everyone. Man, woman, and child" The announcer paused thinking back to his 10 month old son before composing himself. "Every man woman and child born in the month of October has left us today. For reasons we may never know. A state of emergency has been issued in most countries. People are asked to remain in there homes until further knowledge of the horrible proceedings of this afternoon can be further explained..
Dan shut off the TV and hugged Sara tight.
"Should we do as they say? I mean who knows what may.."Dan looked into Sara's eyes before she said.
122.title: What to do?

1222.content:
"Just hold me. I don't want to think any more tonight. I just want to be in your arms. Sara said as the tears began to flow down her tender cheeks. Dan held her through the night with the peace of mind that they had just went to the local supermarket and bought groceries.
"It will be alright, I am here for you." Dan gently wiped the tears from Sara's cheek smearing her makeup.
1222.title: The comfort of a lovers arms

choices: Sara is able to break in time.
12221.content:
8/30/09

The rain on the window calmed Sara as she moved from Dan sliding from his arms. Surprisingly, and despite everything that happened Sara had slept through the night comfortingly in Dan's arms. Sara walked over turning on the coffee pot before grabbing a piece of toast.
"Sara!" Dan wailed and then bolted to his feet looking around before his eyes settled on her.
"Oh, sorry. It was just." Dan said as he seen Sara in the kitchen.
"It is ok I was thinking the same thing before I felt you Against me." Sara saidd as she walked over to Dan.
The two although deeply, in love had always placed there careers before what they deemed as pleasure or recitation. Dan worked as a IT tech at a local college making sure all there systems operated in the best manner while still staying within budget.
Sara was totally different then Dan she had obtained a grant through a university to research a vaccine that would detect and deteriorate most types of cancer.

The news reports of the event of the 29th littered the morning broadcast and radio waves. Despite the fact that people were advised to remain indoors most people simply deemed the current situation a freak accident and figured the best thing to do was to go on with there life's. Dan kissed Sara and told her he would call her, and see her later on tonight. Sara had a to prepare for a presentation that had she had planned for the last few months. as she backed out of the driveway returning a blown kiss to Dan as he prepared to leave her mind was already on the the presentation. Sara found a solstice in the office and that she could produce a "better overall product" with fewer people pestering her. While many people were not in the office on Sunday and even fewer expected to come in after the incident on the 29th. Sara still had a few little quirks to smooth out before the international presentation on the 4th. Lilith had been such a big part of the work that she and Sara along side with Lilith's friend Nancy. The three of them had developed a system that could possibly work given the presentation was a success and the funding was provided.

The traffic was fairly light, most people were taking time off or spending time with loved ones. Sara reached down and flipped on her i pod. The sweet sound of Beethoven's Sonata flowed into her ears and she pulled into the highway.

The car in front of her was slowly weaving back and forth. "Probably on there phone" Sara thought as she slowed her speed and then began to move around the car.

Inside the car Samantha tried her best to control her arm as she felt the sudden sensation running through it. It began as a warm feeling that turned to pain and before Samantha could react her arm felt numb. Instantly Samantha tried to push the pedal to no avail. Her foot simply did not react the muscles were numb and not functioning. In a state of paralysis that increased by the second Samantha found her thoughts scattered as the car began to weave.

Sara watched the car weave and then blared her horn as the woman suddenly waved.
12221.title: Numb

choices: Sara is bruised and slightly hurt
122211.content: Samantha blared her horn and then braced looking at the woman. Her face whether in a state of shock or simply not knowing was faced forward. Sara found this weird before her car was suddenly struck. Sara's car slid sideways and then she wrenched the wheel sending it into a slide. The sound or the screeching of tires was heard before the car was brought to a abrupt stop as the car slammed into the median.
122211.title: Hit

choices: Sara undoes her seat belt and then wonders about the woman
Sara leaves her seat belt on and notices Samantha's car in front of her
1222111.content:
The airbag on the car deployed sending a blinding blow into Sara's face. Sara's hand slammed against the glass of her window before the glass shattered. The seat belt tugged hard into Sara's chest and at her waist but leaved her neck un restrained.

The car rested against the median as Sara tried to regain her thoughts of what just happened. Sara brought her arm up to her neck and rubbed it slowly It was slightly in pain but nothing that would not be suffered by sleeping in a off position on a pillow during the night. Sara brought her hand to her other and rubbed it slightly. All and all it seemed that Sara had only had a small bruise on her hand from the incident.
"That could have been a lot worse" Drummed from Sara's mouth before
1222111.title: Could have been worse

choices: It has slid into the ditch
It has missed the ditch and struck a tree
12221111.content: Sara finds her self un fastening the seat belt as she moves her way to the passioner seat. Sara opened the passioner door and then looks around. A few cars whiz by before they slow and stop. A steady flow of breaking starts behind Sara's crippled car. Sara looks over at Samantha's car and is a bit surprised.
12221111.title: Get out

choices: Back at the house with Dan later that night
122211111.content:
Inside the car Samantha felt the flow of her blood slowing as her eyes grew heavy. The pain had left her, and numbness engulfed her body before her breathing slowed. The body of Samantha lurched a few times as she gasped for air. The sight of a man pulling the door open was the last thing Samantha seen before she blacked out. Wayne looked at the woman. He had seen the accident and the young paramedic.Brought his hand to the woman's neck as he spoke.
"She is unresponsive. She has no pulse and is not reacting to anything. We are on the northbound..."Waynes words were lost as Caroline looked over at Donna who was hunched over in her chair. Caroline proceeded to talk to Wayne as she shook Caroline trying to get a response from her before Wayne heard her yelling at Caroline. The numbness enveloped people around the area most people that had been with family members had fell to the ground in what seemed like a sweet sleep that they did not wake from. Sara told the police who arrived and complained about the sudden "fainting" what had happened.
Most of the people who ventured out had seen the sudden numbness. With no responses people were starting to panic looking for answers. They turned to the news only to find that the only link to the numbness that swept the globe once again was that the month of birth. The convulsions for those in October followed by a numbness for those in November had people. Especially those born in December wondering what tomorrow would bring. The hospitals
were filling up steadily not with the people affected by the events but by the people that were injured by the people affected. The people affected, it seemed, had no or very little effects or history of any aliment that they had suffered before scumming to the event.
122211111.title: A painless escape

1222111111.content:
"Your sure everything is alright?" Dan held Sara tight as he rubbed her neck.
"Yes I am just wondering how that woman must have felt what must have been running though her head when..." Sara said looking into Dan's eyes.
"I am just happy to be with you." Dan said as he looked over as the tv blared a audible alarm.
"..at this point people born in the month of December are being asked to remain calm. Scientist throughout the country are working effortlessly looking for a link between.." Dan switched off the TV and then kissed Sara.
1222111111.title: Hugs and kisses

12221111111.content:
8/31

The sun ran over Brian's face as he stretched on the side of the country road. The Judge lived a life determined by fitness yet took the time to take and respect the sweetness of a sunrise before his morning jog. With the exception of some unavoidable events Brian always attended his morning jog. With most of his immediate family taken by death or simply to far away to reach him Brian was stubborn and did not plan on changing anything even thought his birthday was in December.

The bodies from the first and now second event were being separated from the ones of different months. If the causes were other, then due to convulsions or what was being related to as involuntary paralysis, the corpses were surrendered to the families. But, the bodies that were effected by the "disease" as many were calling it at this point were moved to isolated parts of morgues and even hospitals.

Brian ran past his forth mile, on most days he would been winded and slowing his pace. But, with the sun beaming against his chest, Brian found his feet moving faster against the cracked pavement. The man felt a second wind come over him hearing his shoes as they began smacking the pavement harder.
"That's enough" Brian thought reading himself to slow to a walk. Something seemed to overtake Brian and he found himself running into a full sprint. His feet moving faster his muscles began to ache and his heart thundered against his chest. Brian felt his feet moving faster and could not control his movements. His feet scattered across the pavement then he found his feet stammering before he tripped. Brian's body skipped across the pavement and rolled to a stop. Brian felt the blood roll down his forehead and then wiped it away. Before his body got back to his feet. Despite the harsh fall Brian felt no pain and then brought his hand to his chest. His heart was beating faster his beating more and more erratic trying to keep pace with the rest of Brian's body as it continued to produce more and more adrenaline. Brian reached into his pocket and with shaking hands tried to dial a number only to feel the plastic slip through his fingers as his body lurched over. Brian's heart beating faster into his chest continued beating quicker and more drastically erratic.
A military truck slowly rolled past Brian before slowing and coming to a stop. The corpse that had been outside for a few hours was now motionless and as it was placed into the bed of the truck.
12221111111.title: Can't stop. Won't stop

choices: Move to one of the scientist
122211111111.content:
"The military has begun to remove people from there homes at this point and move them to specified areas to help prevent the spread of what is now being considered a air borne virus." The reporter said as she looked over to a concerned co anchor.
"And now to Tom who is on location at the nations capitol for a briefing that will begin in a few moments in the matter dealing with the events of the last few days" Connie said before looking over to the display of Tom who's face was white as he looked around the room and then into the cameras. Tom paused unable to find words to respond to the information he had just been handed.
"Tom is there something wrong?" Connie said staring at the frozen reporter on the screen.
"In.... in a few moments we will be joined by.." Tom looked down at the paper then lost his speech. The camera swung over to a man sitting behind a podium.
"Presenting General Christopher William Jackson Secretary of National Defense" A official said before stepping aside. The general stepped up to the podium and then stared at the crowd before pulling a remote from his pocket. With a push of a button a projector shined a image of a globe across a screen next to the general.
According to reports from several sources the first initial outbreak begun in the bay area of New York City at roughly 9am eastern time. The event was isolated until it once again emerged at 9am on the coast of the providence of Newfoundland and then Greenland. The event spread through the globe every hour on what would be considered 9 am in a circling motion based upon eastern standard time as a base until it returned to the eastern time zone once again. At that point the reports of involuntary paralysis were reported that moved on to a 24 hour period. In the period of this morning it was reported a massive amount of adrenalin was introduced into the victims body." Christopher looked down at his prepared speech and was a bit shocked to see that the entire next paragraph had been blacked out and the short pause he emitted as a response showed through the confusion dripping across his face as he scanned down to the bottom of the page.
"At this time the government is ordering people to remain indoors and is issuing a mandatory restraint on movement throughout the streets and public areas. This is a measure to confine the loss of life to those affected by this yet to be explained event.
Scientist across the globe are searching for a link between the time of 9am eastern time and the people born during the months of October, November , and December. People born in the month of January are asked to remain calm and..." Yao A reporter born in March stood up out and spoke up over the General.
"You expect us just to die! There has to be more they know. General what are you not telling us. I watched as my 3 year old daughter died this morning. I came here with optimism looking for answers. Yet, you still refuse to present the truth. What are you not."Yao was pulled by a official by the arm as the other reporters were pushed aside.
"What of the president and vice president at this time?"Steve said in a prominent voice looking at the General.
"At this time we can not disclose the presidents location for national security. The vice president has boarded his jet and is moving as we speak...
122211111111.title: Press conference

choices: Move back to Dan and Sara
1222111111112.content:
William moved away from the other scientist and into a small room. William pulled a small pad from his pocket and then began to write.

These samples are showing no sings of any type of abnormal reaction. Though my involvement with the other scientist who have been grouped inside this location we have found no evidence that what is causing this event has anything to do with a biological effect of any kind. It is almost as if by some reason a switch is being turned on causing a natural reaction in the body. The most sophisticated minds in the globe are working on this item and at this point

"You should join the group" one of the MP's said looking at William and then glanced down at his note pad. Perhaps sharing any thoughts you may have could help. The MP said as he escorted William back to the group.
1222111111112.title: Notes

choices: Dan has a itch on his neck
Dan feels a ache in his belly
12221111111122.content:
9/1

Sara held Dan tight she had let him get little rest and was talking to him through the night. His birthday being on the 12th of January she could not help but to think of what may happen. The sun gleamed through the windows and reminded Sara of the time but she still found herself looking at the clock. The events of the last few days had happened at or shortly after nine AM and Sara knew it was coming.
"Sara you know what ever happens that I love you and always will." Dan said as he glanced over at the clock that now read 8:50 am.
12221111111122.title: Tick Tick

122211111111221.content:
Dan brought his hand to his neck and let of a little groan as the muscles relaxed under his hand.
"Are you alright?" Sara asked looking at Dan.
"Yes,My neck just hurts a little is all. " the pain in Dan's neck was slowly growing and he looked over at Sara and in a calm voice.
"Could you get me something to drink, please." Dan said as he slowly itched the back of his neck before looking at Sara.
122211111111221.title: Itchy situation

1222111111112211.content:
The sensation rushed over the back of Dan's head and he found his fingers moving faster at the back of his neck. The itching seemed unbearable and Dan knew it had something to do with the event . Dan grabbed his hand with the other and then looked over at Sara who was looking at him with a great deal of concern.
"Whats wrong Dan tell me please." Sara said and then noticed Dan's muscles flex as he tried to hold his hands next to each other.
"My, neck it itches it is just I don't know it is just a.." Sara came behind Dan and then slowly itched his neck. The sensation subsided for a brief moment then it came back flowing over Dan like a wave. Dan pulled away from Sara and then looked at her taking her hands in his. The sensation grew stronger and before he noticed it Dan had moved Sara's hand away and was itching the skin. Sara noticed the redness and then attempted to grab Dan's arm.
Despite Dan's efforts the more he itched the worse it became. Sara pulled at Dan's arm again and he pushed her away. The sensation moved higher now to the back of the head and Dan found he could not control himself as he felt the blood start to flow down his back.
"Dan stop!" Sara yelled before grabbing Dan's arm and tugging. Dan's thoughts were lost, just the knowledge that he needed to continue itching, digging at the sensation, flooded his mind. Dan barely noticed that he had shoved Sara against the drywall force ably and then lurched over as the fingers tore through the flesh at the back of his head more. Dan's bludgeoned fingers continued scraping against the bone of his vertebrae and then tore through the tender nerves. Sara remained on the floor dazed from the sudden onslaught and watched as Dan stumbled out of the room into the bathroom locking the door.
Sara got to her feet and then banged on the door desperately she looked around the room. Sara kicked at the door a few times and then ran over to the closent and reached inside grabbing a baseball bat.
Dan continued digging traveling through the nerves and muscles digging deeper until he was able to move his fingers around the stem of nerves and with a sudden and uncontrolled spasm Dan tore the stem of nerves free of the skull.
Sara brought the bat across the door handle and then bashed at the lock a few more times it was all for none thought as she found Dan laying on the floor with a pool of blood.
Sara dropped to her knees and tried to figure out what to do. The love of her life had just left her and she could do nothing about it.
1222111111112211.title: Help or hurt

12221111111122112.content:
Throughout the night Sara and Dan had talked about what would happen if he died and Sara was determined to follow his wishes. Due to the recent restrictions only active military personal were allowed to roam the streets. They were ordered to remove the dead and bring them to the local bases where, the public was told, massive graves were established for the people effected by the unfortunate events. This was only partly true. While massive graves had been established, they were quickly filled. Most people and countries considered the event a disease in which the bodies of the dead were instantly burned following death.
This was the effect of what the government eventually followed and the residents around the bases knew it from the smell of the constant amount of burning flesh.
The amount of dead coming in was a huge issue but as more and more people died world wide fewer people were able to respond to there deaths.
While on the 30th the streets were littered with funerals to the point that the decreased traffic was all but a stand still by noon. By the 1st people had begun digging massive graves in there yards for them self's and family members.
Most people simply did not want to wait for the end to take effect and had found a resolution in the tip of a bullet. Sara considered this looking at the bath tub. With tears streaming down her face Sara thought back to the promise she had made to Dan.
With the sun setting, she moved him outside and into the shed before locking it and then going into the house.
12221111111122112.title: Die another Day

choices: Megan brings Sandy to the truck
122211111111221121.content:
9/2

Megan had worked in a day care most of her life. She loved working with children. Her favorite child to play with was Sandy. The 2 year old was very playful and had found a comfort in Megan that was only second to her mother. Megan had done the best she could with Sandy after learning of the young girls parents death on the 30th when they were killed when a car slammed into the side of the passioner train they used to commute to work.
Megan had told no one about Sandy. Megan was unable to have a child and with the loss of Sandie's parents Megan took it upon herself to watch over the child.
Megan knew that Sandie's birthday was in February and thought of how the rest of the people had suffered up to the point. Megan loved the little girl to the point where she had considered a death may be the best option but quickly dismissed it. Megan watched Sandy laying in her play pen as the morning clouds streamed across the sky. The little kitten clock on the wall's eyes moved back and forth as it showed ten minutes from nine o' clock.
Megan knew there was little she could do and although the military had dwindled the only people who were going out doors were people that were burying the dead. The air out on the streets was filled with death. It was not so much from the people that simply had no one to bury them. The problem was from all the animals. Mother nature had never planned for this amount of death and the ground and lakes were cluttered with animals of all shapes and sizes. The sky was filled with instincts that had a daily life span that moved over any living or dead thing around them that went outside.
Back inside the kitten clock showed nine ten and nothing had happened. Megan picked up Sandy and looked at her. She had a small fever and a redness in her cheeks from crying earlier.
"Maybe it has passed her maybe it is over. The whole thing just swept off as fast as it came on." Megan thought and a smile came to her face. Megan looked over at Sandy who now had crawled over and grabbed her bikie and was sucking on it with a vengeance. Megan smiled and then looked at the little two year old. The bikie slipped from the two year olds mouth and she began to whimper before she cried. Megan reached down and slid the binkie into Sandies mouth before picking her up and hugging her. The little girl sucked at the binkie and then Megan felt the binkie tumble down her back followed by a screech from Sandy that was followed by a gurgle then another scream. Megan felt something against her neck and held Sandy away from her. Sandy had blood running down her cheeks and was coughing between wails. Megan grabbed a rag and quickly wiped the blood from the child's lips only to find more run from Sandies mouth. Megan was busy wiping Sandies mouth she had not noticed the blood running down the 2 year olds legs. Megan pulled the diaper off and then let out a gasp the child was bleeding . At that moment the child spit the blood up once again and then her ears and nose started to bleed. Tears stained down Megan's cheeks as she found could do nothing as the child seemed to bleed profusely in front of her. The wails became louder and the child could not help it as she spit up the blood until after about 3 minutes Sandy laid limp in front of Megan.
Megan left the child on the blanket and then walked into the bathroom and started a bath. Megan took the small child and then washed her and dressed her in a bumble bee outfit that she had worn for Halloween that her mother had left at Megan's house.
Megan opened the door and was met by a onslaught of flies and wasp running across her face. She simply continued walking and then noticed a truck parked down the street of the subdivision.
122211111111221121.title: Delayed horror

1222111111112211212.content:
Megan looked at the truck and then noticed the horror in a couples face as a son and his friend moved his mother into the arms of a pair of National guard officers before the body was pulled into the truck. The two boys slowly walked back to the house.
"Sandy deserves better then that" Megan thought and then looked at the motionless child.
"You hungry Sandy?" Megan said in a sweet baby like voice. The child let out no sound and lay limp. Megan heard her laugh and look up at her as Megan strapped her into the hi-chair. Megan got some creamed bananas and put them in a small bowl in front of Sandy and then laid her head down on the kitchen table and closed her eyes.
1222111111112211212.title: A child's voice

12221111111122112122.content:
9/3

Nancy looked at the screen once again analyzing the programming.
"I just don't get it they were not programmed for this." Nancy said as she looked at the empty cages where the test subjects were.
Many of the mice were dead that had been healthy just a few days earlier. The piglets and hamsters were also dead. two of the three chimpanzees were dead. The single monkey left in the cage was named Kansas from which Nancy grew up from.
Nancy has drawn blood from Kansas and was flabbergasted at the presence of nanites.

The model of the protein based nanites has been simple and the programming even simpler. The nanites followed a basic design where they would mask the traits of cancer laden cells. Once masked the cancer and nanites would merge and then slowly, over a twelve day period, the cancer would be removed.
The nanites already incorporated within the cancer would slowly break off and break down the cancer to a point where the mound of cancer could be moved through the blood stream. Once inside the bloodstream the nanites would send a trigger through the body to recognize the cancer and nanites as a waste material. As a waste material the cancer and nanites would be naturally expelled from the body.
The treatment was virtually painless, involved no surgery, covered every and all types, and was something that over time could be added as a immunization as a baby to eliminate any chance of a cancer ever occurring.
The only downside that anyone possible had seen was the number of deaths that would occur due to the lack of the cancerous mound and what it may have held together. But, most of those occurrences could be dealt with surgery to fix any cosmetic damage.

Nancy looked at the screen with a confused face. While the nanites were intentionally intended to be used for cancer they could be adapted to treat a virus or at least slow a viruses progression. By the 2nd Nancy had come to the conclusion that the effects were caused by some form of a virus. The strange thing was the spectrum in which the virus had attacked. It had hit the nervous system, had caused some unexplained mental effects,and had now moved on to the cardiovascular system.What Nancy could not explain is the lack of any defined virus. Nancy was almost certain the nanites could wipe the current incident away from existence. Luckily, the amount of dead was plenty full and acquiring a sample from each stage was easily done.
What puzzled Nancy was the lack of a virus or a outside influence for the effects. It was only upon further examination that Lilith had found traces of her, Lilith's, and Sara's nanites in the sample.
12221111111122112122.title: A cure for cancer

122211111111221121221.content:
Nancy had scrambled for the phone and called Sara asking her to please come in and help her.

Nancy looked at the monitor at a questionable Sara as she walked into the lab. Sara hugged Nancy and then took a seat next to her and then noticed the concern in her face.
"Look at that." Nancy said pointing to the screen and the nanites that moved along the vessels of the tissue.
"I got this sample from a young boy in the park." Nancy said looking at Sara who was in a state of shock.
But how? The nanites are injected into host. They have only been injected into our host. The animals we treated." Sara asked fearing what Nancy already knew.
"I know I came in this morning looking for a answer to the expected epidemic. I thought It was simply a virus and the nanites could link onto it and adapt removing it from the exposed people." Nancy looked at Sara and said nothing.
"But, It isn't a virus is it?" Sara asked trying to stay calm.
"No, The animals we injected the nanites into were freed from the cancer and then they died just as the humans did on the month of there birth. Only Kansas is left because she was born in June. What I found alarming is the fact that Kansas has traces of nanites in her body. The other two chimps do also." Nancy said.
"But, we did not inject them yet. That was the next step towards towards human trials. I was going to discuss that in my presentation. Did someone Inject them?" Sara asked and then knew only herself, Lilith, and Nancy had access.
122211111111221121221.title: Bugged

1222111111112211212211.content:
"I know I thought Lilith may have so I checked the video. No one has injected any amount of the nanites into the chimps. I think it is the nanites ability to adapt. We knew some forms of cancer would manifest in ways and knew that the cancer would mutate the nanites." Nancy said as she typed on the keyboard.
"They adapted. They altered there programming after leaving the host body." Sara said in awe.
"Yes, What I had a problem with was trying to figure out how they were being moved from one organism to another and then considered the amount of time we have been using them. Sara they have been moving around over eight years moving through the water supply the animals and all over the world every organism is exposed at this point. A single protein based nanite can produce millions of offspring through cell division. It simply needed to have the host acquire additional protein if need be." Nancy said to Sara then waited for it to settle in. Sara paused a second and then thought about it.
"I did this, I was the one who worked to modify the nanites instincts to produce and adapt to a cancerous cells" Tears started to stream down Sara's face.
"I killed Lilith and Dan. All of those people simply died due to there.."Sara looked at Nancy confused.
"The time table. Yes that's what confused me also. We programmed the nanites to dispose of the cancer and them selfs on the 12th day. What I believe has happened is due to a unexplained event the nanites have seen 9/9/09 as that day. I believe it has to do with the mathematical equision of 9/9/9. But it could be anything. What is for certain is on the ninth the nanites will stop." Nancy said and then looked at Sara waiting for the question.
"What does it have and do with the month people were born? Oh, wait the nanites.. they are seeing people not born inside of the equision to be a danger."
"Yes, using the equision the nanites were able to communicate with the host determining the date of birth. You did not kill them Sara. You simply allowed them into the host. I killed them, I was the one that established a network for the nanites to communicate to each other to find and deteriorate the cancer cells." Nancy looked over at Sara and then to the clock showing 8:55.
"Remember the first time we reset the nanites. The very first wave before injecting them into the mice. We synchronized them at exactly none o clock eastern time. The massive jolt of electrons to stimulate them before the injection. It was Lilith's idea to expose them I believe that's when they developed the glitch in programming."Nancy looked back at the clock and then looked back to Sara with a bit of sadness in her eyes. Sara looked at the clock and seen it was reading 8:59.
"I think that some types of frequencies disrupt there communication with each other. That's why not everyone seems to have the effects come on all at once." Sara I have always loved you as a sister. I do have one request of you though. See I was born in March. I have seen what the nanites are capable of. They are using the bodies natural defenses and psychology to destroy what they see as a cancer."Nancy said.
The sound of Kansas jumping in her cage could be heard as the chimp grew restless. Kansas moved back and forth finding her self suddenly hot. Kansas waved her arms and Sara noticed the beads of sweat roll down the chimps forehead and then arms. The lab was air conditioned. But even so the chimp began breathing heavily and sweating profusely as her temperature rose higher.
"They are heating up the host to produce a growth of the cancer. The problem is that the entire host being the cancer they will simply continue increasing the temperature" Nancy said as the sweat ran into her eyes. The chimp began screaming and running around in her cage then suddenly fell down and panted quickly in the cage letting out little wails that dwindled off. The chimps body temperature continued to increase. The blood became hotter and the over all temperature rose to over 120 degrees the blood pulsed and the heart beated faster the veins swelled as the blood began to boil The chimps body continued to rise in temp and the smell of burnt toast began to fill the room as the skin began to sag on the bones. The veins swelled to the point where the boiling blood could not be sub sustained and then the veins split open like a overcooked hot dog in a microwave. Kansas lay dead in a pool of sweat and blood.
"Please before it is to late, Don't let me die like that." Nancy said short of breath before dropping to her knees and looking around. Please, Sara not like that..
1222111111112211212211.title: Further explanation leading to more questions

choices: The medical cabinet(a shot in the arm)
12221111111122112122111.content:
"Nancy I can't. There has to be another way." Sara said as she tried to free herself as she felt Nancy grab onto her arm and begin to squeeze.
"Help me please!" Nancy says as she squanders along the floor looking for anything to help her knowing what is to come.
"Please." Nancy says then falls on the floor. The lab was small but had resources around that Sara could possibly use in a hectic reaction Sara seen.
12221111111122112122111.title: Pretty Please

122211111111221121221112.content: Sara freed herself from Nancy's grasp and then moved close to the animal pens. The piglets and chimps were excellent subjects but they did require constant cleaning up after. Sara wrapped her hands around the shovel and then came over and looked down at Nancy who was holding her arms in pain the pressure pushing at her eyelids. Sara brought the shovel down swiftly and struck it along Nancy's.
122211111111221121221112.title: Not enough time for the niceties

choices: Sara is determined to fix the problem
1222111111112211212211122.content: The edge of the shovel was rather dull but after scraping against the concrete for several years it had tapered down a bit. As Sara brought it down she thought of how her grand father would remove the heads from chickens back on her grandparents farm and moved the shovel in the same manner. The edge of the shovel dug against the flesh and then the sound of a crack could be heard from The sweating Nancy. The body went limp and then laid there. Sara had simply knocked Nancy out but that did not slow the nanites and within a few minutes Nancy laid in a pool of blood.
1222111111112211212211122.title: Like grandpa use to do

choices: Riots in the streets during the night
12221111111122112122111221.content:
Sara moved over to the desk and sat down. The smell of the sweat and blood radiated through the room. Sara did not mind and then slowly walked over to Kansas taking care not to look at Nancy. The thought of how Sara would react if Nancy suddenly woke up ran through Sara's head as she pulled a layer of flesh from the chimp. Sara noted how even though the host was dead the nanites continued to heat up the flesh. It was there response to stimulate the cancer. Without a doubt most cancer lay dormant but a sudden temperature change around the cancer mound would cause a growth. It was a simple way to fish out any cancer cells that would be troublesome later on. But, no one had planned on anything like what had happened.
Sara knew the layout of the nanites. They would be introduced and find the cancer, incorporate them selfs with the major parts of cancer and then slowly break them down moving those parts into the blood stream. Upon that they would find and stimulate other cancer cells before breaking them down and then pulling at them tearing that cancer apart. What was to come next is what would really be scary. The nanites would break down the cancer to a cellar level to be passed through the system. Sara typed and analyzed the sample from Kansas and wondered if she could possibly find a way to slow the progression of the nanites.
12221111111122112122111221.title: Working on the problem

122211111111221121221112211.content:
Jamie lay awake looking at the sky. She had never quite enjoyed the clouds. The simple sound of a bird singing in the mist of the morning. The 16 year completed her life. Over the last few days she had lost so many. Every thing around her seemed quieter every day. The smell of death lingered in the streets. The people always seemed in a rush and never seemed to care about the girl with her hollow eyes looking out into the world.
Jamie looked up at the sun focusing on the world and meaning of life. She felt her pioups dilate but kept staring. Jamie wanted to see past the reasoning and into the why and now.
The soft touch of something fuzzy moving across Jamie's calf brought her back to reality. Jamie looked down and then smiled noticing the little kitten. Jamie rubbed her eyes and then let out a little giggle.
Jamie had lived a simple life. A life defined by most as pity full. Looking down at the trace marks in Jamie's arms reminded her what time of day it was and she wandered to the corner where she usually found Buck.
Buck had brought Jamie up from 12 years old. He had shown her the streets both the respectable and dirty aspects.
Jamie scraped her fingers around her arm. Buck was a man who kept a schedule and Jamie knew it he would always pick her up on Thursday morning for fun on Thursday night with associates.
"Come on Buck where are you?" Jamie said aloud looking up and down the street. A little shake followed by a sudden jolt startled. Jamie stayed decent with the clients. She found that the death of most of the residents awarded a almost limitless supply of cash. It did not matter though. Many people stopped taking cash for goods others hoarded what they had. Many of the elite class held them self's in there penthouses watching the news broadcast how many were dead and watching in disbelief as the number grew.
For Jamie though she knew her way out. Her birthday being in April Jamie knew something terrible was coming and had decided to leave before the event overtook her.
122211111111221121221112211.title: A way out

1222111111112211212211122112.content:
"Damn it Buck where the fuck are you?" Jamie said looking around as the sun rose a bit higher in the sky. A escape through the sweet surrender of cocaine is how Jamie had decided to go. Buck had almost lost Jamie before but Jamie had woken up as he was driving out towards the swamplands.
But, now pacing back and forth Jamie wondered if she would have been better off. The sun rose a bit higher in the sky and Jamie felt a tingle run over her as she looked over at the clock that read five after nine.
Jamie reached down and picked up the little kitten and slowly stroked it looking up the street. The kitten purred against the rough hands and then perked it's ears up as a smell entered the young cats nose. The kitten moved it's nose through the air intoxicated by the new smell that seemed overpowering.
Jamie looked down the street and seen what looked like Bucks car. A shrill of relief entered Jamie before she felt a sharp pain in her hand followed by another. Jamie let out a shriek and through the kitten to the ground.
"Fucking cat!" Jamie exclaimed rubbing the blood from her hand. The kitten let out a low growl followed by a hiss. Jamie looked around and then spotted a set of dogs on the side walk next to her. The cat glanced over at the dogs who seemed to be in a daze looking at Jamie. Unpronounced to Jamie was the offensive musk that she was giving off. The smell entered the animals born in the month of April and had sent of a primal trigger. The dogs moved closer and Jamie slid her heals off before turning her back on the dogs and running.
1222111111112211212211122112.title: Bad kitty

12221111111122112122111221121.content: One of the larger dogs zipped around Jamie and then she whipped around only to find the dog in front of her. The full size dog nipped at her arm and Jamie screamed before bringing her fist against the dogs face and running down the street. Jamie ran into a alleyway and looked down it. There was a dumpster and area fenced off for a power box. With the sound of the dogs close approaching Jamie...
12221111111122112122111221121.title: High or low

choices: Sara hears the explosion outside her lab
There is still a few April animals/people alive
122211111111221121221112211212.content:
Jamie climbed the fence with the dogs nipping at her feet before falling against the harsh gravel below. The dogs circled around growling at her. Jamie looked around and seen a few birds perched along the tops of the fence. The sight of a boy with a baseball bat walking into the alley way took Jamie by surprise. The boy was upwind and his gentle footsteps had not got the attention of the dogs. Suddenly the boy felt a tom pounce on his back and he fell to the ground. The dogs looked over at the sound of the bat striking the ground and then began running towards the boy.
"Kid watch ou...."Jamie's speech was cut off. The transformer she had been standing to sent a current through her body that caused her to grab the fence. Jamie's body arched as it acted as a ground and in a instant the transformed she was standing next to exploded.
A wave of em pulse radiated through the alleyway . Upon striking the dogs it caused them to stop in place and then look around. The signal distributed by most of the nanites had been dramatically disrupted. The boy looked up at the dogs in a bit of confusion getting to his feet. The nanites slowly conformed and within a minute the communication was reestablished and the dogs looked at the boy. He swung hit bad in a valiant effort but it did not matter as the teeth of the second dog soon found there mark. The boys esophagus was crushed a few times before it was torn from the boys neck. The dogs suddenly felt tire some and nipped at each other before they began attacking one another. Slowly the blood on the ground stained more and more as the animals attacked one another and the humans born in the month of April until the ground was stained.
122211111111221121221112211212.title: A brief second of serenity

choices: A dog in front of her growling
A man running up to her screaming for help
1222111111112211212211122112121.content:
Inside the lab Sara's tire some gaze drew off of the monitors and to the small note pad on the desk. Nancy was a organized professional in every aspect. But, at times she could be forgetful. Nancy found that carrying a small note pad with her allowed her to jot down any sporadic thoughts she may have. Sara picked up the note pad and flipped through a few pages being careful not to rip them. there was a deal about the nanites and some things to do list amongst a few concepts. Sara read through the small pad with intent and then found towards the end Nancy was writing about the recent discovery of the nanites.
"I believe at this time that the nanites have entered the searching stage to find what they deem as cancer. I know what this means for me but need to tell Sara before it is to late to do anything about it.
I think at this point the only thing that may be able to stop the nanites is a to ...
The sound of a horrific scream brought Sara thoughts back into the lab. There was a flash of light followed by a loud explosion and then the lab went dark.
Sara wandered through the lab until she came to the medal door and then slid it open. The daylight shined against Sara's face before she noticed.
1222111111112211212211122112121.title: Damn kids

12221111111122112122111221121211.content:
The dog lunged forward at Sara knocking her on her back. The dog whom seemed to have signs of rabies brought it's snout along Sara's cheek then stopped throwing it's head into the air before running off. Sara watched the dog as it picked up pace and then glomped a kitten tumbling with it on the dogs side before sinking it's teeth into the cat.
Sara walked back into the darkness and grabbed the note pad from the hard concrete floor. She walked back into the light and then looked at the paper.

I think at this point the only thing that may be able to stop the nanites is a to reset them the way we did before we injected them into the first host. The programming should return to a state of either what we have programmed or a default setting where as the nanites will cease to function all together. Of course if this was the case the current epidemic would not have been a result. But it is the only thing I can think of at this point.
The downside of this is the amount of a jolt it would take. While the injected nanites required a 4 volt shock to reset the 10cc volume of solution containing the 100 nanite cells. Once the nanites have entered the host they would directly seek out the protein and feed off of it to provide energy for cell division. Within one of the mice samples after a single 24 hour period the nanite number rose to the millions. With the time that they have had the nanites could have entered a human host and using the protein naturally supplied through the body could have mirrored more then half the bodies natural cells while still being undetected.
The removal through a jolt of electricity would not only kill the host. But, if even a single nanite existed after the volt it would reconstitute it's numbers within a 24 hour period. Through electricy seems to be a lost cause there has to be another way.
Sara looked at the pad and then heard the sound of the lights and whirling of processors as the lab sprung back to life. Sara walked into the lab and then closed the door.
12221111111122112122111221121211.title: Notes from a old friend

122211111111221121221112211212112.content:
Kimberly sat inside the small cramped dorm and then through some canned goods into a backpack. The onslaught of the recent events caused Kimberly to wonder what she would be deemed with being born in May. Kimberly had lived in the city all of her life and never even seen the country side. With her back pack full Kimberly walked down and got into her Tercel. The car fired to life and Kimberly navigated through the cluttered city streets. The highways and most of the major roads had become un passible. While most people were told to remain indoors very few did. And when the reporters told the public that there seemed to be a like between the deaths and the date of birth many people left the cities.
Kim knew the link and knew about the nine o' clock time in which people were to be affected. her birthday being in march Kimberly made the decision to see the country side and enjoy what little time she had left. In the back of her mind and with the dearest serenity, Kimberly hoped that leaving the city would somehow allow her more time or that she would move outside what ever was causing the effect.
Kimberly drove through the night and then into early hours of the morning. Kimberly arrived at a small waterfall overlooking a forest. Here Kimberly laid down a blanket and rested against a tree watching the morning sun rise into the sky. Kim watched as the country side was alive with wildlife of all sizes as they moved through the morning. Kimberly was taken back at the sight of a hawk circling over the base of the waterfall. The majestic flight seemed almost intoxicating as the bird cascaded higher into the sky.
The incandescent colors burning up the sky son left Kimberly's vision as the sun rose higher. Throughout her life Kim had been healthy. Mostly it was because of her parents genes. But, Kim was not allergic to any thing that she had come across. Kim took a deep breath of the country air and then let out a small cough. The small coughs continued as the pollen began to fill Kim's throat. Kim reached behind her snagging her Mountain Dew and took a demanding sip from it. The coughing stopped but a pain in Kim's throat soon became apparent.
The allergic reaction was only haltered by the flow of the sugary drink into Kimberly's throat. But, while the poilon was only a irritant the sugars and fruits in the drink caused the muscles in Kim's throat to slowly swell.
Kim started to panic. She told herself what ever happened she would remain calm and embrace it and as Kim gasped for air and then looked up at the sky at the hawk that now seemed to be mocking her.
122211111111221121221112211212112.title: Kimberly

choices: Kim places her hand into the water
1222111111112211212211122112121122.content:
A hot burning rash suddenly climbed up Kimberly's legs. The allergic reaction burned with a fire of a venomous bite and Kim's legs became restless. Kimberly found herself up right with the pain from her legs subsiding slightly. One foot moved in front of the other as Kimberly felt her throat swell more.
"I need water!" The thought echoed off the inner dwellings of Kimberly's mind as her feet moved faster until Kim made her way to the bank of the river.
1222111111112211212211122112121122.title: Walking is good for you

12221111111122112122111221121211221.content: Kim's shoe struck a small root along the bay and sent her over the bank. With a huge splash Kim entered the water. Kim thrust her head under and opened her mouth and attempted to gulp water as the current moved her body. The frustration was overpowering as she found no relief and then begin to feel dizzy. The dizziness and the gentle water carrying her felt comforting. And Kim lost consciousness minutes before the young girl's body tumbled over the waterfall to the waiting rocks over 60 feet below.
12221111111122112122111221121211221.title: Watch your step

choices: "It is way past our bedtime we should go to bed."
122211111111221121221112211212112211.content:
Edward sat on the couch the five year old looked at her stuffed kitten sitting in the chair on the other side of her parents breakfast table.
"Craaaaaakkkkkkkkk.Booommmmmmm!!!! The corner of the over sized house shook as a bolt of lightning connected with a near by tree."
"Woa, Sam that one was really close." Edward said looking at the cat and then at the rain soaked window payne.Sam looked back at Edward smiling.
"It sure is bad outside huh, Ed? But, I guess it is good most of the people laying down outside needed a bath. They were starting to smell like Uncle Charlie's feet." Sam said as he took a sip from the china tea cup set before him.

Edwards mother grew up in a middle class family. When Edward was two her mother made her a small kitten. It was made as a pillow for Ed to lay on and something to keep her company during the night. Edwards mother had taken a few pair of old jeans and carved the ears and arms and then stitched them to the hour glass shaped body head combination. Before she filled it with the left overs from the jeans, Edwards mother closely stitched eyes and a mouth and lines representing whiskers in the face. This was not only so the cat could be safe around a two year old. But also, so that the playmate could be cleaned easily. The little girl caried the cat around everywhere and it became her imaginary friend.

Edward let out a yawn and then looked over peeking at Sam's cup.
"Not thirsty?" Edward asked looking at the cat.
"No not really. But, I bet Aunt Karen is. she said she was sick. Maybe some water will help her." Sam said looking at the cup in front of him.
"Your right." Edward yanked Sam by the arm and with the other arm carefully took the tea cup up stairs. Karen had been overtaken by the massive rise in body heat on the 3rd and had died along with the rest born in March. Karen being the only local living relative to the five year old took in Edward. When the effects started Karen had told Edward that she was sick and she was calling a sitter. Karen unsuccessfully called numbers in the last few minutes she had before finally growing to weary as she gasped for air.

Edward tip toed into the bedroom and then gently set the cup on the end table next to Karen's bed.
"Aunt Karen we brought you some..." Sam said before he was interrupted by Edward.
"Shhhhhh, Sam she is sleeping" Edward whispered. The two exchanged glances and tried not to notice the smell coming off of Karen. Sam walked over to the door to Karen's room with Sam close behind and closing it.

"What should we do now Sam?"Edward asked the cat. Sam looked at the grandfather clock at the bottom of the stairs and then said.
122211111111221121221112211212112211.title: Bones

1222111111112211212211122112121122111.content:
"Not so loud Sam." Edward said before looking back at Karen's bedroom door.
"Ok, lets go to bed. But not in our bed on the couch." Edward said I a mistivious voice.
"That sounds like fun. But lets get some of the ice cream and chocolate milk" Sam suggested. Sam was always getting Edward into trouble. He tended to lean towards the fun things that Edward knew were off limits. But, Edward knew that with her mother away she could get away with more. Within a hour the two had the pillows and blanket on the couch and were eating ice cream and drinking chocolate milk into the night. They made it through two movies and fell asleep during the third movie.
1222111111112211212211122112121122111.title: Bedtime

choices: The nanites continued to move along the nerves
The nanites moved to another system
12221111111122112122111221121211221112.content:
The sun came up and shined through the glass. Edward let out a groan as she laid with her leg hanging off of the couch.
"Sam are you up?" Edward asked and got no response. The five year old gripped Sam by the arm and whipped him against the coffee table next to her.
"Ok, Ok I am up." Sam said rubbing the sleep from his eyes and then looked at the clock. The Cat stretched and then attempted to tell the time by himself. The cat could not remember what the numbers represented in relation to a hour and then looked over at Edward.
"It is 8......11" the cat said proud of himself he remembered to say the short hand first.
"Hehe" Edward let out a little laugh then pointed to the clock and said. "No it is not silly it is eight fifties five. Mommy said the leven means fifties five."
"Ok" Sam said and then he looked at the table with the cluster of glasses.
"Here Sam help me clean this up. The two moved te dishes from the living room and into the kitchen. On the final trip back from the coffee table the glass Edward was holding slipped from her hands.
"You alright Ed?" Sam said as he set the dishes into the sink.
"My fingers."Ed remarked looking down at her hand before rubbing her fingers.
"My fingers itch." Ed started running her nails over her fingers in a calm manner. Sam walked back into the room with a dustpan and then looked at the confused look on Edwards face.
"I am sure they are just sticky from the ice cream. Wash them off and then bring a broom back." Sam said as he leaned down to pick up a few pieces of the broken glass. Edward walked into the kitchen and used a chair to lean over the sink. Edward rubbed her hands together vigorously getting the sticky sugary glaze off of her hands.
"Crack'"the sound radiated over the rushing of the water.
"Ow ie, Ow ie, Ow ie!" Edward instantly brought her right hand over her left and embraced the broken bone that protruded through the flesh.
"Whats wrong?" Sam said rushing into the room carrying the dust pan.
"My hand!" Edward yelled then jumped down from the chair. Upon hitting the ground a shock wave echoed through the young five year old body....


For the last few days the nanites were slowly deteriorating her bones making them paper thin. While the bone was broken down and flowed into the bloodstream undetected the nanites conjoined them selfs in a way as to support the lack of bone until the time entire system was ready to execute the next step.
At nine am the nanites dispensed from supporting the bones and the sudden shift caused a muscular reaction causing Edward to drop the glass.
Rubbing the frail bones in her hand while washing them did not help matters any and caused the bone to shift.
Finding the organism aware of the sudden loss of bone the nanites quickly moved to block the pain receptacles. Although they moved fast the sudden reactions of Edward as she panicked had caused her to jump from the chair that had gained her access to the sink.

As the heels of Edwards feet hit the floor...
12221111111122112122111221121211221112.title: Can your cat tell time? Mine can.

122211111111221121221112211212112211121.content:
As the heels of Edwards feet hit the floor the lack of bone could by no means support the weight. The shock wave echoed through her legs as it did the frail bone shattered. The reaction echoed through her continuing higher breaking her hips before leaving Edward limp on the floor.
Edward let out a catastrophic scream causing Sam to cover his ears. Sam ran over and held Edwards hand loosely.
"Sam help me." Edward pleaded looking at the stuffed kitten with tears running down her cheeks. With each word Edward felt her jaw ache as the muscles pulled at the frail bone. The nanites pursuit to establish a network along the nervous system was finally complete. The pain dwindled from the five year old and she held onto Sam's hand tightly. With each sudden movement the sound of breaking bones could be heard. Even with the little girl standing still after some time. The weight of her body sent the frail jagged edges of bone tearing throughout her body. Edward could hear the bones breaking and although the nanites had made her body numb she could feel Sams hand holding hers as she drifted off to sleep.
122211111111221121221112211212112211121.title: Pity

1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.content:
Sara had worked tirelessly developing a separate strain of the nanites. There programming was once again to act in conjunction with the bodies natural defenses to disable the current strain of nanites. Sara knew that the previous strain of nanites could adapt quickly to any threat that may affect them. With this in mind she built the new strain to cooperate with the malfunctioning strain of nanites until such a time a attack could be initiated.
Sara knew that distributing a new strain of nanites world wide was all but impossible. The new strain was developed with increased cell division capabilities it would be the only way to possibly combat the overwhelming amount of malfunctioning nanites.
At this point the worlds population was a mere quarter what it was less then a week ago. As the morning rose on the seventh of September Sara searched around looking for someone that was born in July. After roughly she came across Troy. Troy had been a construction worker. At the age of 31 Troy was a fit man with a wife and child. That was all lost as the cloud of death took everything he had held dear from him. Sara discreetly asked him and explained the possibility of him surviving past nine am. The decision was made with a steady heart.

Sara looked at the clock showing 7am and then back Troy. Pulling the syringe out of the container she wiped down Troys arm and with a steady push of her thumb brought the plunger down. The nanites flowed into the blood instantly acquiring protein and dividing as they spread through out Troys body.
The nanites divided and moved next to the malfunctioned nanites. And by eight AM the nanites had outnumbered the malfunctioning nanites. With little exception the effects had occurred at nine AM. With the knowledge of this Sara had programmed the nanites to execute massive destruction of the malfunctioning cells at the first sign of communication.
The seconds of the clock ticked by as Troy looked up at Sara with anticipation and then at the clock showing Nine fifty.
"Just remain calm the nanites will work. At there current division rate they should more then outnumber the malfunctioning nanites and provide a curtain against any ailment they may affect.
The clock closed upon nine am and the malfunctioning nanites began communicating with each other.
Troys breathing began to quicken as he felt a great pain flow through his chest. The nanites that Sara injected into Troy
1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.title: Company Marches

choices: Venture outside to the people not injected with the New nanites
1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.content: The nanites swarmed over the malfunctioning nanites and began quickly disabling them. The malfunctioning nanites moved to adapt to the destruction caused by the new nanites. But, the sheer number on nanites made the adaption process null. A few malfunctioning nanites adapted to the point where they had required a greater number of nanites to be affected to the point where they were destroyed and would stop communicating. But they were overall eliminated.
1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.title: The Battle

1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.content:
Troys breathing slowed before he looked
over at the clock showing nine ten. The pain in his chest settled and Troy took a unrestricted breath of air.
"Interesting" Sara said looking at the monitor that showed the nanites as they flowed through Troys system.
"Whats wrong?" Troy said a bit concerned as he moved on the lab table restricted by the sensors attached to him.
"I taught the nanites the basis of the malfunctioning nanites and how to disable them. But they seem to be continuing past what I have programmed and are using the protein from the malfunctioning nanites to further divide." Sara said moving away from the monitor.
"Is that good?" Troy said looking at Sara.
"Yes, very good. They are adapting to eliminate any trace of the malfunctioning nanites leaving your system clean of them. Further, by using the protein from the malfuncting nanites they are eliminating any chance of them being redistributed into the population again. Sara smiled and then pulled a sample of the nanites from Troys arm.
"I need to begin producing more." Sara said bringing the nanites over to the machine.
Sara worked through the afternoon and by eight PM that night she was announcing that a possible cure had been made.
The word quickly got around and Sara injected people throughout the night and into the early hours of the morning with the twenty cc injections. The machine produced the nanites at a rigorous pace and with others help Sara managed to treat over seven thousand people before eight am on the eighth.

As the clock neared 9am people not treated became more and more restless to the point Sara and others feared for there life. Sara and some others including Troy moved inside the lab before sealing the doors.
1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.title: Good News

1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.content:
The clock neared closer to nine in the lab and people became concerned wondering if the new "cure" would work. Most were skeptical hoping for the best but denying any hope. The fact that Troy was in the room with most of the people brought a calming tone.
"Watch." Troy pointed to the clock as it counted down the few seconds and then passed nine AM.
"See we are alright." Troy said in honor of Sara who had retired to her office determined to stay calm despite the outcome. The sound of the people outside as they yelled and banged on the door was overpowering. But only lasted a few minuted before it settled down leaving the untreated people born in August dead.
Inside the lab the people rummaged around cramped in the lab taking and reassuring one another happily to be alive.
Troy walked over to the jumble of computers that Sara had been sitting next to earlier and then looked at the monitor. It showed a diagram of the new nanites and a small animation of how it would destroy the malfunctioning nanites. Troy was taken off guard how similar the new nanites and malfunctioning nanites looked. In effect the design was similar but the programming was drastically different.

Inside of Troy the nanites communicated with one another searching the crevices of his body for any remaining malfunctioning nanites.
Deep buried with a platelet of skin of Troys body. A hord of malfunctioning nanites converged as they communicated with the other nanites inside the room that remained dormant. The people inside the room showed no sings in any manner of any type of resistance to the malfunctioning nanites. The time had simply passed 9am and then.
The doors to the lab were opened and the people were shocked to the sight of the untreated people. There bodies seemed to have been scorched to the point the skin had peeled. The people stepped and looked away from the untreated people as they moved out of the room.

Mark came up and dropped to his knees to the sight of his father who had arrived simply to late to be treated. The man took his father in his arms and hugged him the tears flowing down his cheeks.

Deep within Marks father the nanites communicated with the nanites within Mark. A small jolt of electricity was sent through Mark causing him to almost instictly push his deceased father away. Mark stood up and then looked up at the lamp post and the broken bulb above him as it seemed to hum.
Within a split second the nanites within Mark became negatively charged. The lamp post above Mark shot a bolt of electricity through him illuminating the Man for a brief second before he fell to the ground in a limp scorching mass. The people that were treated let out a wail that was quickly silenced. The malfunctioning nanites within the people had adapted to the new strain of nanites and were using them to form a negative charge throughout the treated individuals body before they were struck and killed by any item that carried a charge. Most people found that not moving yielded the best chance of not being electrocuted. But even this was not a possibility.
Troy cam running into the lab yelling for Sara. For some reason he was not affected in the same manner as the people born in August. With a gleam of hope he thought the nanites had passed over him.
Troy ran past the monitors he had seen earlier looking at the animation on the screen and then seen the screen go of as he passed it. He found his feet moving slower and then felt his body come to a stop. Troy faced the monitors and the machine that created the new strain of nanites. The processors suddenly started buzzing before Troy was struck with a jolt of electricity. Troy fell forward onto the desk before the computer and the macinge that produced the nanites exploded in a small burst of sparks sending flames throughout the lab.

The sound of the screams brought the joy and accomplishment to a crashing halt. Followed by a huge explosion throughout the lab. Sara reached for the handel to the door of her office and then.
1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.title: But, we will win the war.

choices: Sara gets out of the lab
Sara is trapped in the flames
1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.content:
Sara through open the door and was greeted with the sight of flames. The heat rushed over her face and then into her eyes throwing her back into the small office.
Sara got to her feet and then ran through the wall of flame. With the lab in flames the amount of burning plastic created a huge cloud of dark smoke. Sara moved to where she felt the door was and then...
1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.title: Hot situation

choices: The woman takes Sara to a house
The woman takes Sara somewhere else
1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.content:
Sara moved through the smoke feeling the flames burn through her clothing and lick at her skin until she finally came through the entrance and out until the street. Sara in a state of almost blindness tripped over Marks scorched body. The feeling of the pavement against her burnt skin as fragments of the asphalt were embedded into her cheek caused her to scream out before her vision returned. Within a moment Sara felt her self lifted and then set on something. Sara felt her face being wiped and most of the ashfault slowly slide free from within her cheek. Sara took a deep breath and then opened her eyes to revel the sight of all the dead that were scorched by the sudden jolt that had echoed through the area around the lab. It was at this time that Sara found her hope lost and without thinking looked at the woman who was born in September.
"We are dead. That was the only hope. It was all I could do. They will win." Sara looked at the woman as she stared at Sara before grabbing her hand and...
1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.title: Out of the flames

1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.content:
Sara was pushed along and then moved into a car that moved down the street swerving around people and objects before it entered a field and finally a dirt road.
"Where are we going?"Sara asked and received no response from the woman. After about 10 minutes the woman looked at Sara and spoke.
"We are going somewhere safe where the nanites can not affect us." The woman said before she handed Sara some clothing.
"It is best if we don't talk until we get closer. We heard about the cure you tried. It was a valiant effort but doomed from the moment you shared the information with a infected individual. Please put this on it is for all of our safety." The woman said before handing Sara a ski mask that had the eyes stitched closed. Sara stared at the mask and then pulled one over her head. Sara watched as everyone but the driver slid the ski mask over there head except the driver.
"Please it is the only way." The woman said feeling the car slow. Sara did not know what these people were doing but felt it may be her last hope and then pulled the ski mask over her head and resting her head along the car door. The car sped up and maneuvered through the night and into morning.

When was Sara born?
1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.title: The Tower

1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.content:
The car slammed into a sand bank before sliding gently into a ditch before coming to a stop.
"What happened?" Sara said as she pulled the ski mask from her eyes. The driver of the car laid limp over the steering wheel and Sara noticed the tape on his hands. The woman and a man in the front seat of the car pulled off there mask and then looked at Sara before the man spoke.
My name is William. I was a scientist that was working on finding a cure to the nanite epidemic that has swept the globe." William said as he looked over at Amanda.
"I am Amanda I was also a scientist working with William on a cure. We found that people in the direct vincenty of cell towers took longer to be affected and we told people about this."Amanda said watching as Sara pieced it together.
"We told more people about the new development and it seemed to work we managed to save over 11,000 people born during the month of February on the second." Amanda paused and then looked at William.
"That was until the third by the third more people had heard about the towers but this time the people born in March had nanites in there body that had adapted to the cell towers frequency and had adapted. Further more the people that we thought we saved were deemed to die along with the people in March. After a few test over the last few days it seems that the nanites realize what we are thinking and seeing. At this point we are within the frequency of a cell tower but if we had not been or if w had told you in any way the nanites would have adapted and we would have been no better off." William said looking at the driver.
"Thats why Nicholas had to die before his eyes could registered the sight of the cell phone tower. He knew what it meant to have you come here." William opened the car door and then looked at his watch showing eight fifty AM.
"In theory it should work. It has worked with the others and everyone else up to this point." Amanda said looking at Sara who seemed in deep thought. Sara looked at William and then Amanda and then opened her door and started to walk towards the cell phone tower. The humming of the tower sent chills up Sara's spine thinking of what the people born in August must have thought after putting there trust in her.
When were you born?"Sara asked as she watched William and Amanda follow her towards the tower.
"I was born the19th" Amanda said.
"I was born the 9th" William said.
"I was born on the 9th also." Sara said and then pulled William aside.
"I think that the nanites find our date of birth in relation to the date of the ninth to be a..."Sara's words were lost as she came over the top of a hill at the sight of almost two hundred people and a make shift camp.
The cell phone tower buzzed over head as Sara noticed the people talking. There faces seemed so calm so relaxed. Sara let out a breath of relief before her eyes came across the sight of Williams watch reading nine o clock.
The people around the tower realizing what time it was.

choices: Someone seen Greg go into the shed
1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.content:
The people were calm as the tower buzzed over head. Sara looked around and realized that William was right the tower had created enough resistance that the nanites could not communicate with one another. Sara looked around at the people as they moved through the small shanty town. Her gaze came across a small cluster of children as they moved around playing kick ball. Suddenly one of the kids kicked the ball with a force that it sent the ball flying. Without thinking a young ball ran after the ball careful not to be seen. The hour passed and people were convinced that they were safe from the nanites grip on them.
The young boy that had gotten the ball from before suddenly sat down and looked around. His name was Greg and while most of the time he was a hyper young man he now seemed quiet. Most people were use to people changing moods and no one took notice as Greg walked towards the generator shed before moving inside.
1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.title: Easy does it

choices: People born on the ninth move on
1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.content:
Greg moved into the shed the sound of the sunning generatior sending shock waves through his body as he found he could not control his movements. Greg's hand reached up and then grabed onto the breaker and then brought it down.
The sound of the generator slowing before it came to a stop sent a wave of terror through the group. William looked at Amanda and then found he could not control his hands. William through Anna to the ground and brought his hands to her neck. Amanda could not move but only stare as she felt Williams grip tighten crushing her windpipe.

Sara felt a great rage looking at a woman next to her before she ran over and brought her hands to the woman's neck. The woman seemed to be still and it seemed the more Sara fought it the more her grip tightened.

Within ten minutes the group of over two hundred had been reduced to a mere fourteen.
Through out the world people born on the ninth of September uncontrollably killed the remaining population around them before realizing what they have done.
1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.title: A messenger

1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.content:
The tenth was a day of grieving the population of the world had been greatly reduced to three thousandths of what it was 12 days ago. The people born on the ninth moved on with the regret and wonder why they had been spared after so many had died. The discussion of the equitation racked a few while others believed otherwise.

The End
1222111111112211212211122112121122111211.title: Move on

12222.content:
An hour or so later, a light knock came at the door. Dan looked up, then back down at the unconcious women in his arms. Poor thing had cried herself to sleep. Another knock, this one louder. Dan did his but to lay Sara down without waking her. When he did, he stared at the face that looked beautiful in any situation. Dan made his way around the bed when something crashed in the living room.
Sara woke up with a start. "What?!" she screamed "What was that?"
Dan was quick to cover her mouth. Shooshing her first; "I'll go out and see what's going on." He wispered, then grabbed a golf club off the dresser.
"Typicle." He thought to himself. "Why is it that every crisis always manages to stir the looters?" Creeking the door open, he peeked into the living room to get a look at the burglar.
12222.title: An Unwelcome Visitor

122222.content:
And on the other side of the door, skulking around the living room, was a monster. At first glance it looked like the beast from the Disney classic. It had dark gray fur, yellow eyes, a protruding dog like face, and a stinch that could wake the dead. It held it's nose high in the air, sniffing for something. Dan was frozen with fear. No way in hell he could take something like that with just a golf club. Out of nowhere it's ears pirked up and it's head swivled in the direction of Dan. The monster met eyes with Dan, causing him to drop his club. For a second, Dan lost all cognative ability. Then the beast smiled a smile that would make small children cry. It seemed to have a look of pity in its eyes before turning back to its sniffing.
"Damn it." the beast said with it's deep, scratchy voice. "Not here EITHER!" It brought its fist down with a force that shook the entire room. Lamps broke, stands toppled, and Dan pissed himself. The beast turned around and started walking on all fours back to the door. It paused in the arch of the door and looked back at Dan. "Hurry up an change your pance moron. You got a lady to get back t... raghhhh raghhh raghhh." The beast coughed. "Stupid shit faced disease. Wasn't even born in October so why the h... raghhh."
122222.title: Not Even Close

info.brief_description: A glitch causes a world wide epidemic. Please add
info.description:
9-9-09 The end of mankind

This interactive may contain items of a graphic nature. While this is a fiction story it is not based upon any specific event or action. Not yet anyway.

Throughout history specific dates and times were thought to represent items of reverence towards the end of mankind. Some people welcome these dates with open arms, others fear them and most simply dismiss them. But, If you knew the end of your journey would you embrace it or run from it?

This is a suspense story. I ask that you refrain from magical things and move towards real world actions. Grammar is not a concern just get your point through clearly. Feel free to go in any direction that you wish with this. If you wish to simply read I have written a little story and it is in italics in the chapter choices.

Please read and add. If your not a member, Join. It is free and you can share your valuable view to this and many other stories on here.

XGC rating is to allow the writer to deem the fate of the world's population without restriction.
